@BWPanda - Yesterday, I picked up a used Dell Latitude E7470 (16 GB RAM and 1TB Disk Space). I am running Regolith Linux with i3 window manager.

My friend @Wilbur Ince is advising me on hardware and software and promises that I'll get lots of geek points for saying that. Is it true?
Ha, probably! I've never heard of 'Regolith Linux'. Looking it up...
Depending how comfortable you are with new things, just be wary of using something advanced like that as a Linux newbie.

@BWPanda - I am a bit wary, but I'm mostly comfortable with this for two reasons:

1) I have good support from an experienced user available.
2) I'm told I can easily boot with regular vanilla ubuntu if I need to.
So, I'm told that I'm not locked into anything.

https://www.omgubuntu.co.uk/2019/06/install-regolith-linux-i3-gaps-ubuntu

Regolith Linux is the i3 Ubuntu Spin You've Been Waiting For
Regolith Linux is a new Ubuntu-based distro that offers an easy to use i3 desktop. You can also install a Regolith desktop session on Ubuntu via PPA.
Welcome to the dark side @StPaulTim , you are part of a subgroup of a subgroup, working on a subproject of a subproject. You next move is off the edge of the universe...
@StPaulTim is for sure on the edge of the universe in Minnesota. If he goes any further he'll end up in Canada.

I'm setting up (again) my laptop as a dual boot to make development easier when I'm not at my main computer. (Yes, it's spring and would be nice to be able to do some work in the back yard from time to time). I had a few issues with a Wifi card driver on newer versions (Ubuntu 21.04-preview, 20.10, Mint linux...) but the Ubuntu 20.04 LTS seems to work. I haven't used Linux extensively for a few years but it feels good to be back. :smile:
